thread.title: Gotham’s Harley Quinn Precursor Set to Debut Later This Season
thread.title_full: Gotham’s Harley Quinn Precursor Set to Debut Later This Season

author: Spencer Perry
title: Gotham’s Harley Quinn Precursor Set to Debut Later This Season
text:
SHARE Gotham’s Harley Quinn precursor set to debut later this season 
Following the return of the show’s Joker-to-be, Jerome, in last night’s episode, TV Guide caught up with Gotham executive producer John Stephens, who revealed that the show will be bringing its version of a Harley Quinn-like character to the series. 
“We might see [her] in Episode 22,” Stephens said, teasing the character will be the “launching point” for the main plot of the show’s fourth season. 
In further Gotham news, you can check out the promo for episode 3.13 in the player below! Titled “Smile Like You Mean It,” the episode is set to air Monday, January 23 and is described as follows: 
“On the run from Gordon and Bullock, Dwight (guest star David Dastmalchian) tries to ?revive Jerome (guest star Cameron Monaghan) and, in turn, activates his acolytes around Gotham City. Meanwhile, Selina’s mom’s (guest star Ivana Milicevic) intentions in Gotham are revealed, and the power play between Penguin and Nygma escalates as Barbara’s plans are set in place.” 
Gotham stars Ben McKenzie as Detective James Gordon, Donal Logue as Harvey Bullock, Michael Chiklis as Detective Nathaniel Barnes, Sean Pertwee as Alfred, Robin Lord Taylor as Oswald Cobblepot/The Penguin, David Mazouz as Bruce Wayne, Camren Bicondova as Selina Kyle/the future Catwoman, Cory Michael Smith as Edward Nygma/the future Riddler, Chris Chalk as Lucius Fox, and Jamie Chung as Valerie Vale, the aunt of future Batman love interest Vicki Vale.
